Why do some antivirus software flag the software as "not-a-virus" or "PUP"?

The software is flagged as "not-a-virus" or "PUP" (Potentially Unwanted Program) by some antivirus software, such as Avast and Kaspersky, because it is mining software that can potentially be installed by a third party to exploit your PC. This is a false positive, and the software is not actually malicious.
